members.name: VERTICAL_SPLIT
members.comment: Vertical split indicates the Components are split along the y axis. For example the two Components will be split one on top of the other.

members.name: HORIZONTAL_SPLIT
members.comment: Horizontal split indicates the Components are split along the x axis. For example the two Components will be split one to the left of the other.

members.name: LEFT
members.comment: Used to add a Component to the left of the other Component.

members.name: RIGHT
members.comment: Used to add a Component to the right of the other Component.

members.name: TOP
members.comment: Used to add a Component above the other Component.

members.name: BOTTOM
members.comment: Used to add a Component below the other Component.

members.name: DIVIDER
members.comment: Used to add a Component that will represent the divider.

members.name: ORIENTATION_PROPERTY
members.comment: Bound property name for orientation (horizontal or vertical).

members.name: CONTINUOUS_LAYOUT_PROPERTY
members.comment: Bound property name for continuousLayout.

members.name: DIVIDER_SIZE_PROPERTY
members.comment: Bound property name for border.

members.name: ONE_TOUCH_EXPANDABLE_PROPERTY
members.comment: Bound property for oneTouchExpandable.

members.name: LAST_DIVIDER_LOCATION_PROPERTY
members.comment: Bound property for lastLocation.

members.name: DIVIDER_LOCATION_PROPERTY
members.comment: Bound property for the dividerLocation.

members.name: RESIZE_WEIGHT_PROPERTY
members.comment: Bound property for weight.

members.name: orientation
members.comment: How the views are split.

members.name: continuousLayout
members.comment: Whether or not the views are continuously redisplayed while resizing.

members.name: leftComponent
members.comment: The left or top component.

members.name: rightComponent
members.comment: The right or bottom component.

members.name: dividerSize
members.comment: Size of the divider.

members.name: oneTouchExpandable
members.comment: Is a little widget provided to quickly expand/collapse the split pane?

members.name: lastDividerLocation
members.comment: Previous location of the split pane.

members.name: setUI
members.comment: Sets the L&F object that renders this component.

param: ui - the SplitPaneUI L&F object

members.name: getUI
members.comment: Returns the SplitPaneUI that is providing the current look and feel.

values.name: escription
values.value: The L&F object that renders this component.

return: the SplitPaneUI object that renders this component

members.name: updateUI
members.comment: Notification from the UIManager that the L&F has changed. Replaces the current UI object with the latest version from the UIManager.

members.name: getUIClassID
members.comment: Returns the name of the L&F class that renders this component.

values.name: escription
values.value: A string that specifies the name of the L&F class.

members.name: setDividerSize
members.comment: Sets the size of the divider.

param: newSize - an integer giving the size of the divider in pixels

members.name: getDividerSize
members.comment: Returns the size of the divider.

return: an integer giving the size of the divider in pixels

members.name: setLeftComponent
members.comment: Sets the component to the left (or above) the divider.

param: comp - the Component to display in that position

members.name: getLeftComponent
members.comment: Returns the component to the left (or above) the divider.

values.name: escription
values.value: The component to the left (or above) the divider.

members.name: setTopComponent
members.comment: Sets the component above, or to the left of the divider.

values.name: escription
values.value: The component above, or to the left of the divider.

param: comp - the Component to display in that position

members.name: getTopComponent
members.comment: Returns the component above, or to the left of the divider.

members.name: setRightComponent
members.comment: Sets the component to the right (or below) the divider.

values.name: escription
values.value: The component to the right (or below) the divider.

param: comp - the Component to display in that position

members.name: getRightComponent
members.comment: Returns the component to the right (or below) the divider.

members.name: setBottomComponent
members.comment: Sets the component below, or to the right of the divider.

values.name: escription
values.value: The component below, or to the right of the divider.

param: comp - the Component to display in that position

members.name: getBottomComponent
members.comment: Returns the component below, or to the right of the divider.

members.name: setOneTouchExpandable
members.comment: Sets the value of the oneTouchExpandable property, which must be true for the JSplitPane to provide a UI widget on the divider to quickly expand/collapse the divider. The default value of this property is false. Some look and feels might not support one-touch expanding; they will ignore this property.

values.name: escription
values.value: UI widget on the divider to quickly expand/collapse the divider.

param: newValue - true to specify that the split pane should provide a collapse/expand widget

members.name: isOneTouchExpandable
members.comment: Gets the oneTouchExpandable property.

members.name: setLastDividerLocation
members.comment: Sets the last location the divider was at to newLastLocation.

values.name: escription
values.value: The last location the divider was at.

param: newLastLocation - an integer specifying the last divider location in pixels, from the left (or upper) edge of the pane to the left (or upper) edge of the divider

members.name: getLastDividerLocation
members.comment: Returns the last location the divider was at.

return: an integer specifying the last divider location as a count of pixels from the left (or upper) edge of the pane to the left (or upper) edge of the divider

members.name: setOrientation
members.comment: Sets the orientation, or how the splitter is divided. The options are: JSplitPane.VERTICAL_SPLIT (above/below orientation of components) JSplitPane.HORIZONTAL_SPLIT (left/right orientation of components)

values.name: escription
values.value: The orientation, or how the splitter is divided.

param: orientation - an integer specifying the orientation
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if orientation is not one of: HORIZONTAL_SPLIT or VERTICAL_SPLIT.

members.name: getOrientation
members.comment: Returns the orientation.

members.name: setContinuousLayout
members.comment: Sets the value of the continuousLayout property, which must be true for the child components to be continuously redisplayed and laid out during user intervention. The default value of this property is look and feel dependent. Some look and feels might not support continuous layout; they will ignore this property.

values.name: escription
values.value: Whether the child components are continuously redisplayed and laid out during user intervention.

param: newContinuousLayout - true if the components should continuously be redrawn as the divider changes position

members.name: isContinuousLayout
members.comment: Gets the continuousLayout property.

members.name: setResizeWeight
members.comment: Specifies how to distribute extra space when the size of the split pane changes. A value of 0, the default, indicates the right/bottom component gets all the extra space (the left/top component acts fixed), where as a value of 1 specifies the left/top component gets all the extra space (the right/bottom component acts fixed). Specifically, the left/top component gets (weight * diff) extra space and the right/bottom component gets (1 - weight) * diff extra space.

values.name: escription
values.value: Specifies how to distribute extra space when the split pane resizes.

param: value - as described above

members.name: getResizeWeight
members.comment: Returns the number that determines how extra space is distributed.

return: how extra space is to be distributed on a resize of the split pane

members.name: resetToPreferredSizes
members.comment: Lays out the JSplitPane layout based on the preferred size of the children components. This will likely result in changing the divider location.

members.name: setDividerLocation
members.comment: Sets the divider location as a percentage of the JSplitPane's size. This method is implemented in terms of setDividerLocation(int). This method immediately changes the size of the split pane based on its current size. If the split pane is not correctly realized and on screen, this method will have no effect (new divider location will become (current size * proportionalLocation) which is 0).

param: proportionalLocation - a double-precision floating point value that specifies a percentage, from zero (top/left) to 1.0 (bottom/right)
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if the specified location is < 0 or > 1.0

members.name: setDividerLocation
members.comment: Sets the location of the divider. This is passed off to the look and feel implementation, and then listeners are notified. A value less than 0 implies the divider should be reset to a value that attempts to honor the preferred size of the left/top component. After notifying the listeners, the last divider location is updated, via setLastDividerLocation.

param: location - an int specifying a UI-specific value (typically a pixel count)

members.name: getDividerLocation
members.comment: Returns the last value passed to setDividerLocation. The value returned from this method may differ from the actual divider location (if setDividerLocation was passed a value bigger than the current size).

return: an integer specifying the location of the divider

members.name: getMinimumDividerLocation
members.comment: Returns the minimum location of the divider from the look and feel implementation.

values.name: escription
values.value: The minimum location of the divider from the L&F.

return: an integer specifying a UI-specific value for the minimum location (typically a pixel count); or -1 if the UI is null

members.name: getMaximumDividerLocation
members.comment: Returns the maximum location of the divider from the look and feel implementation.

return: an integer specifying a UI-specific value for the maximum location (typically a pixel count); or -1 if the UI is null

members.name: remove
members.comment: Removes the child component, component from the pane. Resets the leftComponent or rightComponent instance variable, as necessary.

param: component - the Component to remove

members.name: remove
members.comment: Removes the Component at the specified index. Updates the leftComponent and rightComponent instance variables as necessary, and then messages super.

param: index - an integer specifying the component to remove, where 1 specifies the left/top component and 2 specifies the bottom/right component

members.name: removeAll
members.comment: Removes all the child components from the split pane. Resets the leftComonent and rightComponent instance variables.

members.name: isValidateRoot
members.comment: Returns true, so that calls to revalidate on any descendant of this JSplitPane will cause a request to be queued that will validate the JSplitPane and all its descendants.

members.name: addImpl
members.comment: Adds the specified component to this split pane. If constraints identifies the left/top or right/bottom child component, and a component with that identifier was previously added, it will be removed and then comp will be added in its place. If constraints is not one of the known identifiers the layout manager may throw an IllegalArgumentException. The possible constraints objects (Strings) are: JSplitPane.TOP JSplitPane.LEFT JSplitPane.BOTTOM JSplitPane.RIGHT If the constraints object is null, the component is added in the first available position (left/top if open, else right/bottom).

param: comp - the component to add
constraints - an Object specifying the layout constraints (position) for this component
index - an integer specifying the index in the container's list.
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if the constraints object does not match an existing component

members.name: paintChildren
members.comment: Subclassed to message the UI with finishedPaintingChildren after super has been messaged, as well as painting the border.

param: g - the Graphics context within which to paint

members.name: paramString
members.comment: Returns a string representation of this JSplitPane. This method is intended to be used only for debugging purposes, and the content and format of the returned string may vary between implementations. The returned string may be empty but may not be null.

members.name: getAccessibleContext
members.comment: Gets the AccessibleContext associated with this JSplitPane. For split panes, the AccessibleContext takes the form of an AccessibleJSplitPane. A new AccessibleJSplitPane instance is created if necessary.

values.name: escription
values.value: The AccessibleContext associated with this SplitPane.

return: an AccessibleJSplitPane that serves as the AccessibleContext of this JSplitPane

members.comment: Creates a new JSplitPane configured to arrange the child components side-by-side horizontally, using two buttons for the components.
Creates a new JSplitPane configured with the specified orientation.

param: newOrientation - JSplitPane.HORIZONTAL_SPLIT or JSplitPane.VERTICAL_SPLIT
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if orientation is not one of HORIZONTAL_SPLIT or VERTICAL_SPLIT.

members.comment: Creates a new JSplitPane with the specified orientation and redrawing style.

param: newOrientation - JSplitPane.HORIZONTAL_SPLIT or JSplitPane.VERTICAL_SPLIT
newContinuousLayout - a boolean, true for the components to redraw continuously as the divider changes position, false to wait until the divider position stops changing to redraw
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if orientation is not one of HORIZONTAL_SPLIT or VERTICAL_SPLIT

members.comment: Creates a new JSplitPane with the specified orientation and the specified components.

param: newOrientation - JSplitPane.HORIZONTAL_SPLIT or JSplitPane.VERTICAL_SPLIT
newLeftComponent - the Component that will appear on the left of a horizontally-split pane, or at the top of a vertically-split pane
newRightComponent - the Component that will appear on the right of a horizontally-split pane, or at the bottom of a vertically-split pane
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if orientation is not one of: HORIZONTAL_SPLIT or VERTICAL_SPLIT

members.comment: Creates a new JSplitPane with the specified orientation and redrawing style, and with the specified components.

param: newOrientation - JSplitPane.HORIZONTAL_SPLIT or JSplitPane.VERTICAL_SPLIT
newContinuousLayout - a boolean, true for the components to redraw continuously as the divider changes position, false to wait until the divider position stops changing to redraw
newLeftComponent - the Component that will appear on the left of a horizontally-split pane, or at the top of a vertically-split pane
newRightComponent - the Component that will appear on the right of a horizontally-split pane, or at the bottom of a vertically-split pane
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if orientation is not one of HORIZONTAL_SPLIT or VERTICAL_SPLIT

name: javax.swing.JSplitPane
comment:
JSplitPane is used to divide two (and only two) Components. The two Components are graphically divided based on the look and feel implementation, and the two Components can then be interactively resized by the user. Information on using JSplitPane is in How to Use Split Panes in The Java Tutorial.

The two Components in a split pane can be aligned left to right using JSplitPane.HORIZONTAL_SPLIT, or top to bottom using JSplitPane.VERTICAL_SPLIT. The preferred way to change the size of the Components is to invoke setDividerLocation where location is either the new x or y position, depending on the orientation of the JSplitPane.

To resize the Components to their preferred sizes invoke resetToPreferredSizes.

When the user is resizing the Components the minimum size of the Components is used to determine the maximum/minimum position the Components can be set to. If the minimum size of the two components is greater than the size of the split pane the divider will not allow you to resize it. To alter the minimum size of a JComponent, see JComponent.setMinimumSize(java.awt.Dimension).

When the user resizes the split pane the new space is distributed between the two components based on the resizeWeight property. A value of 0, the default, indicates the right/bottom component gets all the space, where as a value of 1 indicates the left/top component gets all the space.

Warning: Swing is not thread safe. For more information see Swing's Threading Policy.

Warning: Serialized objects of this class will not be compatible with future Swing releases. The current serialization support is appropriate for short term storage or RMI between applications running the same version of Swing. As of 1.4, support for long term storage of all JavaBeans has been added to the java.beans package. Please see XMLEncoder.
